responses.rationale: The segment describes animal recovery, not prices, economic data, or numerical metrics.
The segment reports a numerical metric (production volume) using standard descriptive language: 'total turkey production... was usually about 8.5 to 9 million birds'.
The segment reports a numerical metric (affected birds) using standard descriptive language: 'seen around 600,000 of those free range birds being directly affected'.
The segment reports a numerical metric (production volume) using standard descriptive language: 'farmers usually produce 1.2 to 1.3 million free range birds'.
The segment reports a potential economic metric ($10 billion) using standard language ('risk nearly $10 billion') without vivid verbs or risk adjectives describing the loss itself.
